subject: Re: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: I think that there is two kinds of situations (and something in between :-) ... 1. if some assert fails all subsequent asserts have no sense 2. all asserts
messageBody:
I think that there is two kinds of situations (and something in between :-)
:
1. if some assert fails all subsequent asserts have no sense
2. all asserts independent, i.e. one failed does not exclude (make
senseless) others.

In the 1st case you should not want to continue test case after one failed.
In the 2nd case your could split you test case onto slmaller test cases, one
assert per test case.


Alexander

>
> testInsert(){
>
> assertTrue();
> - - - - -
> assertEqual();
> - - -
> assertXYZ()
> }
>
> In above case if first assert method i.e. (assertTrue()) fails, JUNIT
> displays failure which is occurred at
> first assert only & It dosent test or checks others assert() Methods.
> My question is:
> How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods
> fails in a TestCase?
